On Friday 19 September 2003 15:03, Jason Rogers wrote:

[snip]

> assertTrue(
>     new HairyExpression () {
>         public String evaluate() {
>             ...
>         }},
>     false);

[snap]

> There are of course better ways of doing these things.  I just wanted to
> make the point that we can make the framework do anything we want.  Is it
> pretty?  No.  But if it's necessary who cares if it's pretty (he says
> tongue-in-cheek)?

Sure, it could be done that way. And if anyone did, I'd send them on a
computing aesthetics course. For tests, I'd rather take the performance
hit of always evaluating the string. In real code, I'd want to be writing an
extra language layer.

-- 
Chris "electric hedgehog" Dollin
